fields.descriptive_line: Sketch book, probably by Thomas Barker (1778-1865), containing interior views, drop scenes, scenes from productions and studies of actors, including Eliza O'Neil, Charles Mayne Young and William Conway, at the Theatre Royal, Covent Garden and the Theatre Royal, Drury Lane, London. 46 pages of white wove paper thread stitched. 1815.
fields.physical_description: Sketch-book inscribed by the artist in pencil and ink with play titles, characters, notes on actors' performances and dates. Watercolour on white wove paper thread stitched. 1815.
fields.location: Prints & Drawings Study Room, level C, case 91, shelf B, box 31
Prints & Drawings Study Room, level C

fields.name: Prints & Drawings Study Room, level C

fields.bibliography: Victoria and Albert Museum Department of Prints and Drawings and Department of Paintings, Accessions 1968 London: HMSO, 1969. The full text of the entry is as follows: 'BARKER, Thomas (1778-1865), Probably by Sketch-book containing interior views, drop-scenes, scenes from productions and studies of actors, including Eliza O'Neil, Charles Mayne Young and William Conway, at the Theatre Royal, Covent Garden and the Theatre Royal, Drury Lane, London. 46 pages of white wove paper thread stitched. 1815. Inscribed by the artist in pencil and ink with play titles, characters, notes on actors' performances and dates. Water-colour. Size of volume (15.9 x 9.8 cm.) E.175-1968 Purchased from the funds of the Gabrielle Enthoven Bequest Note: Although the sketch-book is dated 1815 throughout, Barker refers to a production of Shakespeare's Romeo and Juliet with William Conway and Eliza O'Neil in the leading roles. The only record of such a production is that at the Theatre Royal, Covent Garden, London, 6 October 1815. Milton's Comus with William Conway in the leading role, revived at the Theatre Royal, Covent Garden, London. 4 February, 1815. Jane Shore by Nicholas Rowe, with Eliza O'Neil and Charles Mayne Young in the leading roles, produced at the Theatre Royal, Covent Garden, London, 29 June 1815. Shakespeare's Richard III with Edmund Kean in the leading role, revived at the Theatre Royal, Druary Lane, London, 6 October 1815.'
fields.credit: Purchased from the funds of the Gabrielle Enthoven Bequest
fields.history_note:
Although the sketch book is dated 1815 throughout, Barker refers to a production of Shakespeare's 'Romeo and Juliet' with William Conway and Eliza O'Neil in the leading roles, produced at the Theatre Royal, Covent Garden, London, 6 October 1814.

Productions identified are: 'The Stranger' by Benjamin Thompson, with Eliza O'Neil and Charles Mayne Young in the leading roles, produced at the Theatre Royal, Covent Garden, London 4 February, 1815.

Milton's 'Comus' with William Conway in the leading role, revived at the Theatre Royal, Covent Garden, London, 28 April 1815.

'Jane Shore' by Nicholas Rowe, with Eliza O'Neil and Charles Mayne Young in the leading roels, produced at the Theatre Royal, Covent Garden, London, 29 June 1815.
Shakespeare's 'Richard iii' with Edmund Kean in the leading role, revived at the Theatre Royal, Drury Lane, London, 6 October 1815'
